backend/main.mo: Motoko canister managing admin registration and an officer directory with add, update, delete, and query operations plus message payload generation.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report listing implemented features, affected files, components, and test IDs for Firebase telemetry setup and admin bootstrap actions.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: Prewritten summaries of all frontend React components, pages, hooks, and utilities used across the app.
frontend/FIREBASE_RTDB_FIELDS.md: Documentation describing the expected Firebase RTDB root-level telemetry fields, aliases, and example structure for sensor data ingestion.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind CSS setup defining theme variables, dark mode values, and global styling rules.
frontend/index.html: Base HTML document setting meta tags, PWA manifest, icons, and root mount point for the React app.
frontend/public/manifest.webmanifest: PWA manifest defining app metadata, icons, colors, and display behavior.
frontend/public/sw.js: Service worker implementing a simple network‑first caching strategy for PWA support.
frontend/PWA_AND_LOCAL_RUN.md: Guide for installing the app as a PWA on Windows and instructions for running the project locally.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Main React app configuring TanStack Router routes, authentication guards, and theme provider.
frontend/src/components/admin/FirebaseTe: Provides a UI button and confirmation dialog to initialize Firebase telemetry fields and displays success or error states.
frontend/src/components/charts/LineTrend: Renders a temperature and humidity line chart using Recharts, with a fallback message when no data is available.
frontend/src/components/charts/StatusPie: Displays a pie chart of alert status distribution, mapping prediction and prevention levels to chart values.
frontend/src/components/dashboard/Alerts: Shows critical, warning, or normal status alerts based on alertStatus prediction and prevention levels.
frontend/src/components/dashboard/Summar: Generates a grid of summary metric cards displaying telemetry values or demo data.
frontend/src/components/layout/AppLayout: Defines the main application layout with header, navigation, footer, and routed page content.
frontend/src/components/messaging/Office: Creates an officer alert message based on telemetry and alert status, allowing selection of officer and copy-to-clipboard.
frontend/src/components/officers/Officer: Dialog form for adding or editing an officer with validation and Firebase mutation handling.
Displays a table of officers with options to call, edit, or delete, and opens the edit dialog when needed.
frontend/src/components/reports/ReportsC: Renders a responsive bar chart of aggregated report data or shows an empty-state message.
frontend/src/components/reports/ReportsT: Shows a summary table of aggregated report data with totals or a no‑data message.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Creates and caches an authenticated or anonymous backend actor and refreshes dependent queries when it changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides Internet Identity authentication context, including login, logout, identity loading, and status handling.
frontend/src/hooks/useOfficers.ts: Convenience hooks wrapping officer queries and mutations for listing, adding, and deleting officers.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: React Query hooks for fetching, adding/updating, and deleting officers in Firebase with automatic cache invalidation.
frontend/src/hooks/useTelemetry.ts: Subscribes to Firebase telemetry data, normalizes fields, updates state and store, and builds time‑series history.
frontend/src/index.css: Tailwind setup defining color variables, base styles, and fade/pulse animations.
frontend/src/lib/alertStatus.ts: Computes alert levels based on telemetry, detecting active fires or risky environmental conditions.
frontend/src/lib/clipboard.ts: Provides a helper to copy text to the clipboard with error handling.
frontend/src/lib/demoTelemetry.ts: Supplies demo telemetry values and generates random hourly time‑series data.
frontend/src/lib/firebase.ts: Contains Firebase config and a mock RTDB client that polls data via REST.
frontend/src/lib/officersRtdb.ts: Implements CRUD operations for officers in Firebase RTDB using REST calls.
frontend/src/lib/reporting.ts: Aggregates telemetry time‑series into monthly or yearly warning and alert summaries.
frontend/src/lib/sms.ts: Builds SMS deep links and triggers the device SMS app with a prefilled message.
frontend/src/lib/telemetryBootstrap.ts: Initializes root telemetry fields in Firebase RTDB using a PATCH merge.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Bootstraps the React app with React Query and Internet Identity provider.
frontend/src/pages/Dashboard.tsx: Renders the dashboard UI, loading telemetry, alerts, charts, and admin/demo controls.
frontend/src/pages/Login.tsx: Implements a login form with hardcoded credentials and CAPTCHA validation, navigating to the dashboard on success.
frontend/src/pages/Map.tsx: Displays GPS coordinates from telemetry and an embedded OpenStreetMap view with copy-to-clipboard support and fallback handling.
frontend/src/pages/Officers.tsx: Provides officer directory management with search, list display, and a dialog for adding new officers.
frontend/src/pages/Reports.tsx: Renders monthly and yearly telemetry-based reports with charts and tables, supporting demo mode when data is missing.
frontend/src/pages/Splash.tsx: Shows a branded splash screen with project credits and a button that navigates users to the login page.
frontend/src/state/authSession.ts: Handles simple auth state using localStorage with login, logout, and authentication checks.
frontend/src/state/telemetryStore.ts: Defines a Zustand store for telemetry data with a setter function.
frontend/src/types/telemetry.ts: Declares telemetry and time-series type definitions for sensor metrics and historical records.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Configures Tailwind with custom colors, typography, animations, and plugin integrations.
project_state.json: JSON describing project state for a forest‑fire monitoring web app, including versioning, feature list, architectural notes, and known issues relating to Firebase and UI flows.
